required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparaison of 3 Protocols of Ocytocin Administration in C Section
clinical_study.official_title: Comparaison of 3 Protocols of Ocytocin Administration in Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimed to compare 3 doses of ocytocin in bolus injection and contnious perfusion during C section. these doses determined by: high, intermediate and low doses, were administred to parturients during elective or urgent C section under spinal anesthesia

detailed_description.textblock:
This study aimed to compare 3 doses of ocytocin in bolus injection and contnious perfusion during C section. these doses determined by: high, intermediate and low doses, were administred to parturients during elective or urgent C section under spinal anesthesia.
The aim was to determine the lowest efficient dose to prevent post partum hemorrage and with the lowest incidence of maternal side effects.

study_design_info.masking_description: pre filled syringues of ocytocin were given to the care provider who didn't know the exact amount of ocytocin bolus and continious infusion

primary_outcome.description: uterine tone juged by the obstetrician

secondary_outcome.description: delta hemoglobin: preoperative HB- Post operative HB
necessity of Additive boluses of Ocytocin

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 minutes after C section
secondary_outcome.description: Tachycardia, hypotension, nausea vomiting, headache, chest pain

arm_group.description: the patients of this group recieved conventionnal doses of ocytocin after foetal extraction in C section: 5IU in bolus followed by 15IU in continuous infusion
the patients of this group recieved after foetal extraction in C section: 2IU in bolus followed by 10IU in continuous infusion
the patients of this group recieved after foetal extraction in C section: 2IU in bolus followed by 5 IU in continuous infusion

intervention.description: Administration of lower doses of Ocytocin in bolus and continuous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients scheduled for C section under spinal anesthesia, monofoetal pregnancy, full term
Exclusion Criteria:
- necessity of general anesthesia
- non conscent

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor head of the anesthesia and intensive care department

clinical_study.keyword: Cesarean section, ocytocin, uterine tone, side effects
